title: What are some Chinese history books that aren't too broad? Maybe something that focuses on a time period. - Quora

response.answer_text: Clements, Jonathan (2004). Coxinga and the Fall of the Ming Dynasty. Stroud, Gloucestershire: Sutton. ISBN 978-0-7509-3269-1 .fascinating chap half Japanese sometime raised in Macau after bonking his dad’s other wife , wanted to be a scholar ended up leading the Ming loyalists against the Qing , he had an African unit , he had another unit of human tanks , strong chaps who carried a thick iron suit on their front normal clothes on the back The Qing instituted a scorched policy of the coast so 50 Chinese miles coastal region was vacated Clements also discusses a German astronomer priest in Macau who was interested in cannons and led a multi national charge in Macau , in which about 10 countries had representatives in the battle
